summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Gilman Avenue, from Emerson Street to Twenty-third Avenue West; Twenty-third Avenue West, from Gilman Avenue to Commodore Way; and Commodore Way, from Twenty-third Avenue West to Twenty-seventh Avenue West, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing a plank roadway, sixteen (16) feet in width, thereon, in accordance with Resolution No. 661 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
